title: RIP Darius
body:
{{champion:122}} Penta in LCS. Watch as he gets gutted, as bronzies completely ignore that C9 had a team built around him, and FNT made some poor choices against him.

EDIT: Copying my reply from below:
"That's exactly it. By building a team that shred towers, you force the other team to hard engage on you before it's destroyed. Darius literally just has to sit between the enemy and his back line and they have to go through him. Remember, his greatest weakness is being kited which is irrelevant if they're forced to come to him."

This is the real reason he did so well. This is also why he doesn't normally do so well in organized play. In most other circumstances the other team wouldn't have let this slide at select.

replies.body:
They had a backline that forced FNT to engage, which means they had to go through Darius. A Morgana to disable CC, and Azir and Morgana both have massive amounts of CC. They absolutely destroyed FNT at champ select. This wasn't Darius being OP, this was what LCS should be.

It still blows my mind that they picked Yasuo into him. Why not gnar?
Because every comp is a Yasuo comp.
The fact they tried to pick Yasuo at professional level, they deserve to lose.
Technically, Yasuo can work, just not into Darius and not in that situation.
FNC did some poor choices, C9s baron calls were worse than them. C9 did not deserve the win.

2 horrible baron calls should be GAME OVER for a team. Instant loss. The Yasuo pick was bad, the last teamfight was bad, C9 was playing utterly bad and still won due to Darius.
umadbro?
usilencedbro?

If the Darius pick was so good, Fnatic should have known that and banned him.
They should have known that picking a Yasou into a Darius was a bad idea.
They should have been able to capitalize on the 2 bad baron calls to win the game.

If Fnatic deserved to win the game, they would have.

Darius needs to be gutted, if there is champion that basically has a garenteed win in their lane, it needs to be stopped.

Q has percentage heals and damage, with a low cooldown
His passive at level 18 gives him 200 bonus AD
His ult deletes too much
His has too much cc with that pull, I know that's his only cc, but its too much.

Darius is just way too overboard since his rework.  He needs to be worked down to the bone so that a tank... sorry BRUISER THAT BUILDS FULL TANK.... doesn't delete people.

while I agree he needs to be nerfed, to say he needs to lose his identity as the dunkmaster is silly. this is what darius does. he has ALWAYS done this pre rework. the real problem as you saw in the fnatic vs c9 fight just now is that 200 ad being applied instantly with 5 stacks is absolutely insane. way overpowered. The heal was broken, and honestly probably still needs a nerf, but the 200 ad is crazy. i think he got one Q off and an auto on rekkles and the bleed alone killed him because of his bonus AD. 

the dunk resets will always be a thing as they should be. this is what makes him a threat. If you take this away there would never ever be a reason to pick a darius. Think of darius like the risky top lane version of katarina. If you get the resets you leave enemy team wondering why they didnt ban you or focus you. If you dont, you look silly and useless (much like all the other darius have looked so far). 

I hate darius, I think champions like him and katarina are frustrating to play against. but to say he needs to lose all the things that are good about him is a bit ridiculous. the passive 200 ad and heal are the main thing.  the pull is essential or he'd be useless and his ult is what makes him darius.

I am not saying take away his ult, I am saying he shouldn't be able to sustain himself to such a degree, deal so much damage, and then ult to instantly delete 75% health targets, yet have 4k health and tons of armor. Its not right.  he needs to either deal a lot of damage, or be able to take a lot of damage. Not both.

his concept is fine. his kit's general idea is fine. what makes him broken is purely the numbers. they are simply too high. the heal is too strong. the bonus ad on passive way way too high. the instantly applying of 5 stacks is also unnecessary

> [{quoted}](name=Chuck Charles,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EKaU9NyA,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-04T18:26:08.109+0000)

> his concept is fine. his kit's general idea is fine. what makes him broken is purely the numbers. they are simply too high. the heal is too strong. the bonus ad on passive way way too high. the instantly applying of 5 stacks is also unnecessary

Um, a self-heal qualifies as tanking? It's like you're saying "he's not as good a tank, he just has a way too highly powered tanking ability. He's not as good of a dps as an actual glass cannon, he just has a way too overpowered dps kit." Uhhhhhh... splitting hairs much?

There is no issue with him dealing LOW amounts of damage if he builds tank, and there is no issue with him doing lots of damage if he has LOW health.  But the juggernauts have LOTS of damage, and LOTS of health and armor.  They shouldn't try to make tanky champions deal lots of damage like that.  Cause its stronger than other options.  Therefore, it shouldn't be in the game, they can either A: make him a tank, or B: make him a damage dealer.

Also, its not about his DPS, its about how he can instantly delete targets.

That's the concept of a juggernaut, it sounds broken but the idea of a juggernaut is they bulldoze anyone in their way, but people easily stay clear of them and poke at them at every chance. 

It sort of works out like this, or is supposed to anyway:

http://9gag.com/gag/aVXV7jw

Thing is, how are you supposed to survive a darius that flashes on top of you, then pulls you back when you try to flash away???

If they are so tanky, yet able to kill people so easily, then they need to be slower, and Darius does not need a pull.

if he has a flash, you have one too. if we're talking innately, he actually has 0 mobility so his pull is his only way to get people to him. He shouldn't be in range to flash on top of you, and if he does a flash pull, it also means you get to flash after his pull unless you burnt it elsewhere (teamwork OP?). 

That doesn't mean every champ has no trouble avoiding him. Most juggernauts (except it seems, Garen and Skarner who are somewhat more mobile than their fellow bulldozers) are very highly immobile (such as Nasus/Sion/Darius/Morde) and can be kited more easily than your standard assassin fighters. But if you are a very low mobility champ like Kog or Lux, and somehow get into his range, he will be more punishing to you than say... an Ez/Fizz/Vayne. That being said, I've won full build duels with him with Yi, though that's nothing to brag about I guess.

Okay, for your very first sentence, I stated "flashes on top of you, then pulls you back when you try to flash away".... so yeah....
Also, most Darius player's I have seen that are good, will pull you as you flash, so that takes care of that, and Darius actually has a bit of movement speed, considering his base MS is higher than GPs apparently... (I played a GP against Darius a while back)
Yeah, any high mobility champ can stay away from him, the issue with that is nobody wants to be FORCED to play Ez/Fizz/Vayne every single game just to deal with a Darius. (notice I say FORCED for those who main highly mobile champions)
Plus, there is also the issue of Darius that isn't taken into account when it needs to be is HE HAS A TEAM, team fights can't be fought cause Darius will run straight through to the backline and pull his target in to its death, unless that target just outright abandons the fight and lets his team die, which would happen regardless...
For those that say "just peel and take him down" think about that for a moment.  How much crowd control, time, and abilities would it take to deal with a tanky Darius? All while in the middle of a team fight...  Your whole team will be forced to target the tank that will be keeping himself alive via his Q while the Darius' team can just get free kills. So no, just peeling and killing Darius is such a simple answer, with a very low chance of actual success.

If all that is needed is just a specific champ for your team to be able to win like that, its time to call Rito for a nerf.

I don't disagree with what you are saying, but for every nerf darius gets, resourceless cooldownless hypermobile cancer yasuo should get twice the nerf. I hate that mop-haired, herpe-lipped, street-trash, anal-wart that shows up every game sliding around the map with no cooldowns. 

Darius might be strong, but no one ruins games like Yasuo.

Yasuo is easy to take down if you pay attention, he gets so much unnecessary hate...

Yes, he has next to no cooldown on his dashes, BUT, it requires an enemy target, one that he hasn't dashed through in about 10 seconds, also, he is extremely easy to predict on his dashes, and he is extremely squishy.

If you have issues hurting him in lane, use a ranged champion or one with no mana, just hit him whenever his shield is charged and he will have to stay back or risk getting damaged.

They nerfed Sivir cause of her team comp... that's just a comment I felt like putting out there....

Also, let me put it to you in simple terms as to why he was still nearly perma-banned after his nerf....

There is a game, with 120 different characters all with a medium power level, lets give them numerical values and stats like in pokemon games.  Medium power level would be your average pokemon at level 50, they might have a high numerical value in one or maybe two stats depending on their role, but overall, nothing too ridiculous.
THEN a new character in that game is deemed too weak and given the max amount of points possible in their stats, lets say 999 in everything.
Then say that character was nerfed after being deemed too strong, but that nerf was only 300 points in all stats, yet given a new ability that makes them survive for a lot longer.

Tell me, would you deem that character as "balanced" after that nerf?  Would you allow that character to be played, possibly against YOU? Or would you do what the rest of the world is doing and keep that cancerous mess out of the game?
Exactly, this is my point.  ^

Also, I find it to be really funny when someone bases overall game balance and similar issues with how pro's play the game.

The vast majority of League of Legends players, are below Diamond.  The vast majority of League of Legends players don't run with a full group of 5 players who can communicate via voice chat.  And the biggest point of all, THE VAST MAJORITY OF LEAGUE OF LEGENDS PLAYERS ARE NOT AT THAT LEVEL OF PLAY.  

Everyone at Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Diamond all lack the experience and skill to get to Master/Challenger.  That is just a simple fact, that is why they are not in Master/Challenger.  So saying that champion isn't good, or is good because of Pro Players is not a very good basis for your reasoning.

Pro Players are Pro's cause they have superior strategy, mechanics, and when problems arise, they are able to plan accordingly.  Before a team fight happens, everyone knows where they are gonna be, who they are gonna target, and where they will end up.

But the rest of us, we just run around without any true strategy, our mechanics are decent-good but not the best, when we find out a new issue it takes us longer to deal with it.  And before team fights, we scream at each other "FOCUS THIS GUY, CAUSE REASONS" and during the team fight we have poor positioning, target wrong enemies, and just screw up ALOT.  And that is just at the bronze-gold levels.  Before I get hate messages about how "we don't do that" realize its a generalization and if you did everything right, you wouldn't be Bronze-Gold....

Darius can't instantly delete anyone unless there is some massive feeding happening.  Nothing Darius does is instant and he isn't going to kill anyone unless he gets his passive activated which takes 5 hits.

Well... He does have a pull, he gets 5 autos on ONE person, then ults them.  If that kills that target, he only needs ONE AUTO TO AUTOMATICALLY APPLY 5 STACKS AND ULT THEM FOR INSTANT DELETION, ULT CD RESET, AND REFRESH ON THE PASSIVE, RINSE AND REPEAT....

How is that not being able to insta delete?

Because the process of getting 5 stacks for the first time takes a minimum of about 4 seconds (I did the math but didn't keep the numbers somewhere easy to put in here), and that includes using any tricks Darius has to get them on faster.  His ult will do about 1000 damage with full stacks, so anyone he goes after will need to have taken at least some damage from a source other than Darius to make it so he can ult them for the execute after one auto or Q even with Noxian Might active.  Just remember that his autos will take about 1.4 seconds each so he does not really get to insta-delete anyone unless they walk up to him at really low health, and then they deserve it.

If his auto's take 1.4 seconds each, then how does Darius get 5 stacks in 4 seconds (his Q has a windup and requires distance from your target)? You can't have it both ways there buddy.  Besides you are forgetting that Darius does have his pull after getting his stacks and killing his first target, as well as flash, as 90% of players don't play OSU and have Miyagi reflexes when someone flashes on top of them.  AS WELL AS DARIUS'S OTHER TEAM MATES, people don't understand to factor in Darius's team mates which is such a crucial point, since there are so many champions that can chain cc their targets for a massive amount of lockdown time.

He can get 5 in 4 seconds by using his Q, an auto, followed by his W auto reset, and then two more autos.

You also have teammates.
Darius benefits greatly in 1v2 as he can heal for more.
Of course he will also be CCed and damaged more.  There is also a possibility that your ally, or you, positions so Darius can only heal off of one of you (this isn't hard).

I have a smurf account called MariahCarriedYou....

Anyways, Quinn is an ADC, really squishy.  The issue with countering Darius with a Quinn in the top lane is that you will lose valuable cc and tank options for the rest of your team.
